title: League of Legends not playing smooth (FPS drops lately)
body:
Hi all, i know there are already alot of topics about the FPS issues. Or well its not the FPS, its some kind of stuttering i get from 10 minutes, with as result at the end of the game 100fps and stutters very badly (starting with 230+fps). 

I had already contact with Nvidia and they cant find it out too. Vsync on seems beter but give me some delay. I have nearly tried all settings (Nvidia Inspector). Im hopeless and it is really getting annoying. 
Im playing on a laptop called Asus Rog GL-553VW, with a GTX960M, i7-6700HQ, 16GB ram. 2x 250gb SSD.  

Ps: Capping my frames on 60fps does really help my GPU to get less loaded and heated over time (no i dont have any temp issues at all). It is just feeling more stable when my Vsync is on but unplayable cuz of the delay there is or some weird kind of playing. 
I really really hope someone can help me because im struggling for a long time now (especially Soulstealer Vayne skin laggs very badly)

Good evening all.

replies.body: its not just the minions tho the shop drops the frames crazy too like to 75fps

> It is just feeling more stable when my Vsync is on but unplayable cuz of the delay there is or some weird kind of playing.

All in your head, vsync will not add more than around 10-20ms delay.

Make sure you have triple buffering off.

I myself had had problems with FPS drops on my Desktop, I just bought a new laptop and now its fine...
Riot has said within the past week that its working on fixing these lag issues
it has to do with Minions and some particles, the longer the game goes the worse it gets, im pretty sure it has something to do with invis particles not disapearing and it just adds up overtime.
Oke nice, atleast a good thing that Riot is trying to fix it. Yes it actually begins when the minions come on my lane... Baron buff is very nasty too
